Articles.Content:
Everything you said there is correct. Also arent those B9 lights magnificent on the Orion SM? That might be my favourite combo.

I find that the go pretty well on anything

I find that the go pretty well on anything

Agreed. Best illumination part ever.
I want!

Have you considered approaching Nertea about including anything from his Near Future Propulsion pack?

I understand that VASIMRs are potential candidates for propulsion on a Mars mission

Have you considered approaching Nertea about including anything from his Near Future Propulsion pack?

I understand that VASIMRs are potential candidates for propulsion on a Mars mission

My opinion based on everything I could find to read on the subject is that some day VASIMR engines will make travel to mars more efficient, but the first human flights will probably take place before a large enough VASIMR system exists to be of any utility at that scale. Also in the absence of a more current baseline I'm tying to stay within at least arms reach of NASA/SP-2009-566-ADD http://www.nasa.gov/pdf/373667main_NASA-SP-2009-566-ADD.pdf with the exception of the goofy aeroshell heat shields which I think look dated considering the various successes with inflatable heat shields which have taken place over the last few years.

Also re the baseline above I'm not completley sold on drop tanks with heavy strucutral elements vs traditional staging... but that is a complicated issue.

Edited January 7, 2014 by YANFRET

http://www.nasa.gov/pdf/373667main_NASA-SP-2009-566-ADD.pdf

Oh man, the Reentry Fairing, coupled with the slender body inflatable thing is just too cool! Btw i really like the drop-off vehicle design (both single tank and multi-tank).

http://www.nasa.gov/pdf/373667main_NASA-SP-2009-566-ADD.pdf

Oh man, the Reentry Fairing, coupled with the slender body inflatable thing is just too cool! Btw i really like the drop-off vehicle design (both single tank and multi-tank).

Did you see pages 192 and 193? = 0

My opinion based on everything I could find to read on the subject is that some day VASIMR engines will make travel to mars more efficient, but the first human flights will probably take place before a large enough VASIMR system exists to be of any utility at that scale. Also in the absence of a more current baseline I'm tying to stay within at least arms reach of NASA/SP-2009-566-ADD http://www.nasa.gov/pdf/373667main_NASA-SP-2009-566-ADD.pdf with the exception of the goofy aeroshell heat shields which I think look dated considering the various successes with inflatable heat shields which have taken place over the last few years.

Also re the baseline above I'm not completley sold on drop tanks with heavy strucutral elements vs traditional staging... but that is a complicated issue.

I'm curious. Who else has given an OK for releasing these parts? Have you implemented any custom IVAs? Are you using the Rasterprop glass cockpit mod if you have done IVAs? This looks good, and will work well with pretty much any of the aforementioned mods, and Kethane if you make your own models. Also, are you planning any smaller rovers or utility truggies?

I'm curious. Who else has given an OK for releasing these parts? Have you implemented any custom IVAs? Are you using the Rasterprop glass cockpit mod if you have done IVAs? This looks good, and will work well with pretty much any of the aforementioned mods, and Kethane if you make your own models. Also, are you planning any smaller rovers or utility truggies?

My curiosity stems from wondering if your interiors are as well executed as the textures and remodels of these parts.

My curiosity stems from wondering if your interiors are as well executed as the textures and remodels of these parts.

Oh I wouldn't know where to begin with an interior. These guys in the ALCOR thread do, WOW! Fancy stuff goin on over there.

Combining his outer panels with the fabric under panels

You are correct.

I don't think you answered his question, he said 2 things and asked which one of them it was.

In response to Driftwood, this is a collection of parts from various mods that have been tweaked and retextured to fit together from a gameplay and visual standpoint. They will be released in one pack if permission can be obtained from the various mod creators.
